history.proof: qsimpl time: 1 use: isocele_permute. qsimpl time: 1 use: isocele_permute.

ctx: intros A B M O H1 H2.
exceptions.tactic: apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H1.
exceptions.exn: In environment A, B, M, O : PO H1 : isocele O M A H2 : isocele O M B The term "A" has type "PO" while it is expected to have type "isocele ?A ?B ?C".

ctx: intros A B M O H1 H2.
exceptions.tactic: apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H2.
exceptions.exn: In environment H : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A C) (vec A B)) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B C)))) pi A, B, M, O : PO H1 : isocele O M A H2 : isocele O M B The term "A" has type "PO" while it is expected to have type "isocele ?A ?B ?C".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall A B M O : PO, isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> R (double (cons (vec M A) (vec M B))) (cons (vec O A) (vec O B))

Premises:
double = fun a : AV => plus a a : AV -> AV
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
*** [ cons : V -> V -> AV ]
isocele = fun A B C : PO => R (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)) : PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
*** [ PO : Type ]
*** [ R : AV -> AV -> Prop ]
*** [ vec : PO -> PO -> V ]
isocele_permute : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A C) (vec A B)) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B C)))) pi
triangle_isocele : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (double (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)))) pi
somme_triangle : forall A B C : PO, R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (plus (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)))) pi
opp_vect : forall A B : PO, vR (opp (vec A B)) (vec B A)
v_vec : forall (u : V) (A : PO), exists B : PO, vR u (vec A B)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
option_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> option A -> option B
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
double_permute : forall u v w t : V, R (double (cons u v)) (double (cons w t)) -> R (double (cons v u)) (double (cons t w))
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Inductive sumbool (A B : Prop) : Set := left : A -> {A} + {B} | right : B -> {A} + {B} Arguments sumbool (_ _)%type_scope Arguments left {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments right {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
ssrbool.if_expr : forall A : Type, bool -> A -> A -> A
BinInt.Z.le_ind : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m -> A (BinInt.Z.succ m)) -> forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m
orthogonal = fun u v : V => R (double (cons u v)) pi : V -> V -> Prop
colineaire = fun u v : V => R (double (cons u v)) zero : V -> V -> Prop
regulier_cons : forall u v w t s : V, R (cons u v) (cons u w) -> R (cons u t) (cons u s) -> R (cons v t) (cons w s)
reflexion : forall i u v u' v' : V, R (cons u' i) (cons i u) -> R (cons v' i) (cons i v) -> R (cons u v) (cons v' u')
non_vide_P : exists A : PO, A = A
R_permute : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u v) (cons w t) -> R (cons v u) (cons t w)
rotation : forall u v u' v' : V, R (cons u u') (cons v v') -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
Refl.make_impl : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop -> Prop
vR_R_compatible : forall u u' v v' : V, vR u u' -> vR v v' -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
R_double : forall a b : AV, R a b -> R (double a) (double b)
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments Datatypes.cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Chasles_2 : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u t) (plus (cons u v) (plus (cons v w) (cons w t)))
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z

```coq
intros A B M O H1 H2.
apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H1.
apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H2.
rewrite <- H1.
rewrite <- H2.
apply (R_double _ _).
Qed.```

original: intros A B M O H1 H2. apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H1. apply (isocele_permute A B M) in H2. rewrite <- H1. rewrite <- H2. apply (R_double _ _).
